text: William Dampier (baptised 5 September 1651; died March 1715) was the first Englishman to explore parts of Australia. He was the first person to circumnavigate the world three times. On one voyage he rescued Alexander Selkirk, a sailor who may have inspired Daniel Defoe's Robinson Crusoe. ==References== Category:1651 births Category:1715 deaths Category:English explorers Category:People from Somerset Category:Privateers
title: William Dampier
